snippet: Almost eight in 10 participants in a Rutgers University study said that they had lost a job in the last few years, or were close to someone who had.
abstract: Rutgers University survey finds nearly 25 percent of Americans say they were laid off at some point during the recession or afterward; nearly 8 in 10 say they know someone in their circle of family and friends who has lost a job; majority say they think it will be at least six years before economy recovers, if ever.
